DOC.brief_summary: 1. To examine whether Ritalin has analgesic properties in healthy subjects. 2. To examine if Ritalin analgesic effect is a pain specific phenomenon or a part of a broader, non-specific effect on high mental functions.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Methylphenidate Hydrochloride on Pain and Auditory Sensitivity in Healthy Subjects
DOC.criteria: Male subjects between the ages of 20 to 40 Healthy subjects without known disease and without any chronic pain Subjects without known cognitive problems, which can understand the research and its goals Subjects who are not taking any medications Subjects without hearing problems Subjects without attention deficit disorder (ADHD) problems Subjects who are known to suffer from any disease or any chronic pain Subjects taking psychotropic drugs (except Ritalin) or any analgesics Subjects who have any contradictions for ritalin administration subjects with suspected cognitive disability
